summary:
The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions and statements on Yemen, adopted Resolution 2534 (2020) on 14 July 2020. The resolution extends the mandate of the United Nations Mission to support the Hodeidah Agreement (UNMHA) until 15 July 2021. 

The Security Council reaffirms its commitment to Yemen's unity, sovereignty, independence, and territorial integrity. It endorses the Hodeidah Agreement and calls on parties to implement it. 

The mandate of UNMHA includes: 
- leading and supporting the Redeployment Coordination Committee (RCC) 
- monitoring the ceasefire and redeployment of forces 
- working with parties to ensure the security of Hodeidah city and ports 
- facilitating United Nations support to assist parties in implementing the Hodeidah Agreement 

The resolution approves the Secretary-General's proposals on UNMHA's composition and operational aspects. It underlines the importance of close collaboration among United Nations entities operating in Yemen. 

The Security Council requests the Secretary-General to: 
- fully deploy UNMHA expeditiously 
- report monthly on progress and any obstructions 
- present a further review of UNMHA at least one month before its mandate expires 

The Security Council calls on parties to support the United Nations and requests Member States to provide support as required. It decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
